summary: This document is a compilation of news articles from August 13-14, 2019, primarily focused on the aftermath of Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody. It includes victim testimony from Jennifer Araoz, details of the jail security failures, political reactions, and updates on other unrelated federal cases in the SDNY. The document highlights the ongoing investigations into Epstein's death and the legal efforts to pursue his co-conspirators.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; found dead in his jail cell on August 10, 2019, while awaiting trial on federal sex trafficking charges. Multiple articles discuss his crimes, the 2008 plea deal, and the circumstances of his death.

persons.name: Jennifer Araoz
persons.context: Describes in a first-person account being recruited at age 14 and raped by Jeffrey Epstein in 2001-2002. She is filing a civil action under New York's Child Victims Act.

persons.name: William Barr
persons.context: Urged by Senator Sasse to rip up Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement. Promised accountability for Epstein's death and to pursue co-conspirators. Ordered investigations into the suicide.

persons.name: Ben Sasse
persons.context: Sent letters to AG Barr demanding the 2008 Epstein plea deal be ripped up and answers about the circumstances of Epstein's suicide in custody.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Frequently described as Epstein's former girlfriend and alleged 'madam' who recruited underage girls. Reported to be living in Massachusetts with Scott Borgerson. Facing increased scrutiny after Epstein's death.

persons.name: Alex Acosta
persons.role: Former U.S. Attorney for SD Florida, former Labor Secretary
persons.context: Negotiated the controversial 2008 non-prosecution agreement with Epstein. Lost his cabinet position due to the fallout from the deal.

persons.name: Lamine N'Diaye
persons.context: Warden of the jail where Epstein died; temporarily reassigned to a Philadelphia office pending investigation.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.role: U.S. Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Vowed to continue the investigation into Epstein and his co-conspirators. Also mentioned in the Ben Sprecher child porn case.

persons.name: Mark Epstein
persons.role: Jeffrey Epstein's brother, real estate investor
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein's younger brother. Offered his Florida home for bond. His real estate company, Ossa Properties, has curious links to Jeffrey's company, J. Epstein & Co.

persons.name: Scott Borgerson
persons.context: Reported to be in a relationship with Ghislaine Maxwell and living with her in a Massachusetts mansion.

persons.name: Jean-Luc Brunel
persons.context: Epstein's MC2 modeling agency business partner. An alleged victim claimed she was forced to have sex with him.

persons.name: Nadia Marcinkova
persons.context: Operated a business registered at Mark Epstein's 301 East 66th Street building, identified as a potential co-conspirator.

persons.name: Sarah Kellen
persons.context: Operated a business registered at Mark Epstein's 301 East 66th Street building, identified as a potential co-conspirator.

persons.name: Ehud Barak
persons.context: Reported to have regularly spent time at the 301 East 66th Street condominium owned by Mark Epstein.

persons.name: Ben Sprecher
persons.context: Arrested on federal child pornography charges on August 13, 2019, in an unrelated case included in the news digest.

persons.name: Joel Margulies
persons.context: Convicted on August 13, 2019, for fraud related to a snack and pet food investment scam, in an unrelated SDNY case.

persons.name: Sohrab Sharma
persons.context: Facing fraud charges related to a cryptocurrency initial coin offering, in an unrelated SDNY case.

persons.name: Robert Farkas
persons.context: Facing fraud charges related to a cryptocurrency initial coin offering, in an unrelated SDNY case.

persons.name: Greg Craig
persons.role: Former Obama White House Counsel, defendant
persons.context: Facing trial for allegedly lying to federal investigators about foreign lobbying work for Ukraine, mentioned in the 'Matters of Interest' section.

persons.name: Steven Donziger
persons.context: Facing criminal contempt prosecution for allegedly failing to comply with court orders in litigation against Chevron, mentioned in the 'Matters of Interest' section.

persons.name: Jose Rojas
persons.context: Expressed anger that MCC Warden Lamine N'Diaye was reassigned but not placed on administrative leave like the guards.

persons.name: James Petrucci
persons.context: Warden at Otisville federal prison named acting warden of MCC after N'Diaye's reassignment.

persons.name: Hugh Hurwitz
persons.context: Received a letter from House Judiciary Committee leaders demanding answers about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Jerrold Nadler
persons.context: Co-signed letter to BOP acting director demanding answers about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Doug Collins
persons.role: U.S. Representative (R-GA), House Judiciary Ranking Member
persons.context: Co-signed letter to BOP acting director demanding answers about Epstein's death.

persons.name: Oren Barzilay
persons.role: Head of FDNY EMS union Local 2507
persons.context: Commented that FDNY members were not responsible for leaking details of Epstein's death.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Represented Epstein victims; quoted in 2009 saying Jeffrey Epstein kept 'his girls' in apartments owned by his brother Mark.

persons.name: Kenneth E. Marra
persons.context: Presided over the CVRA litigation related to Epstein's 2008 plea deal, found prosecutors violated victims' rights.

persons.name: Lewis Kaplan
persons.context: Presided over the Chevron/Donziger litigation and appointed special prosecutors to pursue criminal contempt charges against Steven Donziger.

persons.name: Rita Glavin
persons.context: Appointed by Judge Kaplan to prosecute Steven Donziger for criminal contempt.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as Epstein's former girlfriend, closest pal, and alleged 'madam' who recruited underage girls for him. Court papers allege she engaged in threesomes with victims.
Araoz alleges Epstein raped her when she was 15 after recruiting her through a stranger near her school. She visited his home regularly for over a year.
They are brothers. Mark offered his home for Jeffrey's bond. Business connections exist between Mark's Ossa Properties and Jeffrey's J. Epstein & Co.
Reported to be in a relationship and living together in a mansion in Manchester-by-the-Sea, Massachusetts.
Brunel was Epstein's partner in the MC2 modeling agency. An alleged victim claimed she was forced to have sex with Brunel.
As U.S. Attorney, Acosta negotiated the 2008 non-prosecution agreement that allowed Epstein to plead guilty to state charges and avoid federal prosecution.
Senator Sasse sent letters to Attorney General Barr urging action on the Epstein plea deal and investigation into Epstein's death.
Barrett runs Mark Epstein's Ossa Properties and was also an asset manager for Jeffrey Epstein's J. Epstein & Co.

events.title: Jennifer Araoz's Abuse Begins
events.description: Jennifer Araoz, age 14, is first recruited and begins visiting Jeffrey Epstein's Upper East Side mansion. The abuse escalates over a year, culminating in rape.

events.title: Epstein's Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: U.S. Attorney Alex Acosta negotiates a deal where Epstein pleads guilty to state charges, serves 13 months in a Florida state prison, and receives immunity for himself and potential co-conspirators from federal charges.

events.title: Epstein Arrested in New York
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is arrested on federal sex trafficking charges filed by the SDNY and is held at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC).

events.title: Epstein's First Suicide Attempt
events.description: Epstein is found injured in his MCC cell, resulting in him being placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Found Dead in Cell
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein is found unresponsive in his cell at the MCC at approximately 6:30 a.m. and is later pronounced dead. Apparent suicide by hanging.

events.title: Guards Placed on Leave, Warden Reassigned
events.description: Two MCC guards are placed on administrative leave for allegedly falling asleep and falsifying logs. MCC Warden Lamine N'Diaye is temporarily reassigned.

events.title: Jennifer Araoz Files Civil Action
events.description: Jennifer Araoz announces she is filing a civil action against Jeffrey Epstein's estate and accomplices under New York's Child Victims Act.

events.title: Ben Sprecher Arrested for Child Porn
events.description: Broadway producer Ben Sprecher is arrested on federal charges of possession and distribution of child pornography in an unrelated case.

locations: Jeffrey Epstein's mansion, Upper East Side, Manhattan
301 East 66th Street, Manhattan (building owned by Mark Epstein)
Manchester-by-the-Sea, Massachusetts (mansion where Ghislaine Maxwell reportedly lives)
Palm Beach, Florida (location of Epstein's Florida mansion)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019, in an apparent suicide by hanging.
Two guards assigned to watch Epstein were placed on leave for allegedly falling asleep and falsifying log entries to show they had made required checks.
Victim Jennifer Araoz provided a detailed first-person account of being recruited at age 14 and raped by Epstein, and announced a civil lawsuit under the New York Child Victims Act.
Senator Ben Sasse urged Attorney General William Barr to 'rip up' Epstein's 2008 non-prosecution agreement to allow co-conspirators to be prosecuted.
Ghislaine Maxwell, Epstein's alleged 'madam,' was reported to be living in seclusion in a Massachusetts mansion with tech CEO Scott Borgerson.
